title.narrative: Dissemination and Synthesis of Urban/Peri-Urban Climate Change Adaptation Projects
Synthèse et diffusion des travaux sur l'adaptation aux changements climatiques en milieu urbain et périurbain

description.narrative:
Planning for climate change in urban and peri-urban areas adjacent to rural areas is a relatively new phenomenon. Since 2007, when the Fourth Assessment report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) was published, international donors have launched numerous urban adaptation programs. Despite the programming surge, there is limited information about whether adaptation is taking place, and how. This research support project aims to fill this gap by asking IDRC-funded researchers to address two key questions: -What happens when local actors come together to adapt to climate change? -What are the broad lessons emerging from the practice of adapting?
Specifically, this project will support the involvement of IDRC-funded researchers in the Resilient Cities Conference in Bonn, Germany, in 2013. The goal is to disseminate research findings from selected Climate Change and Water projects on urban climate change adaptation. Selected researchers meeting the following criteria will participate in organized panels at the conference: -potential to contribute sound research results; -capacity to write and present in English; -geographic area of focus; and, -researchers' gender and level of seniority.
Panel themes include: -Adapting urban water management; -Integrating resilience into urban planning and development; and, -Including vulnerable social groups in resilience and adaptation solutions.
Ten panellists have been confirmed, representing projects from Latin America, Africa, South Asia, Southeast Asia, and the Middle East. Additional spots will be filled with selected city representatives familiar with the research projects.
This research support project is expected to result in 10-12 working papers, which will be presented at the conference. This project will provide evidence to inform Climate Change and Water's mid-term achievement reporting, while also providing researchers with a forum to share knowledge, network, and produce peer-reviewed papers.
